title: Sans Serif from "Four Christmases"
content:
I apologize that there’s not much to go on here, but anyone have any idea what this Gotham-y sans is from the _Four Christmases_ one sheet?

| --- | --- |

author: Spencer Cross

comments.content: Very interesting. I don’t find this Gothamesque, but it is almost a kind of modern Gill Sans. I’m interested in the answer if anyone can ID it.

I’m pretty sure it’s just Verdana.

- Lex

it’s more than one font. _Christmases_, as well as the actors names and the copy, are set in [Albany Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105348/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/albany). _Four_, however, is not.

It looks like it “FOUR” could be a stroked Albany.

- Lex

[That’s it!](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105348/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/albany_std_virtual/?sample_text=FOUR%20Witherspoon) Good work, fellas. I had forgotten all about Albany. Looks like WTF is on the fritz, or it’s ignoring the Monotype stuff that MyFonts doesn’t carry.
Thanks folks! I did try WTF, but I figured the type samples just weren’t big enough. It never occurred to me that they might not ID stuff they don’t carry.
As far as I know, they do. Just speculation on my part.
